        <othercit>The CEA was created by DC GIS using written regulations and with the advice of NCPC staff. Both the District of Columbia and the National Capital Planning Commission define the CEA.</othercit>

    </citation>
    <descript>
      <abstract>The polygon layer represents the location and attributes of Central Employment Area in Washington, DC 2002</abstract>
      <purpose>This data is used for the planning and management of Washington, D.C. by local government agencies.</purpose>
      <supplinf>The District of Columbia defines the CEA in its Comprehensive Plan DCMR Title 10 (<http://planning.dc.gov/documents/docs/Chapter_1_General_Provisions.pdf>) and the National Capital Planning Commission has a parallel definition.</supplinf>
    </descript>

    </timeperd>

      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Dataset copied from the CD Obtained from Washington, DC 2005

Jurisdictions were identified from public records (map and written description created by the National Capital Planning Commission) and heads-up digitized from the 1995 orthophotographs. The resulting shapefile was then recreated as a coverage using the appropriate planimetric features (street centerlines, etc.) and the polygon built.

A base ArcInfo coverage of correct line work (snapbase.e00) for all DC data was developed after the final delivery of the planimetric street centerlines. The datasets were selected from the snapbase coverage, creating coincident geography with the other DC GIS datasets. When imported into the DC GIS geodatabase the coverages shift 0.01mm since the geodatabase supports only 11 digits of precision, not double precision (16 digits).

Planimetrics were created at a scale of 1:1,000. This means that a well defined feature falls within two feet of true position.

All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters.</procdesc>
        <procdate>20010806</procdate>
        <proccont>

      </procstep>
